https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/92395/ : SUCCESS

`eventData` has `uint8_t*` type, while `write()` requires `const char*` so `const_cast<>()` and `static_cast<>()` will not work.

With `const_cast<>()`
```
../platform-mc/event_manager.cpp:400:19: error: invalid ‘const_cast’ from type ‘uint8_t*’ {aka ‘unsigned char*’} to type ‘const char*’
  400 |         ofs.write(const_cast<const char*>(
      |                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  401 |                       pldm_platform_cper_event_event_data(cperEvent)),
``` 
With `static_cast<>()`
```
../platform-mc/event_manager.cpp:400:54: error: invalid conversion from ‘uint8_t*’ {aka ‘unsigned char*’} to ‘const char*’ [-fpermissive]
  400 |         ofs.write(pldm_platform_cper_event_event_data(cperEvent),
      |                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                                      |
      |                                                      uint8_t* {aka unsigned char*}
```

Correct the data type when calling CreateDump D-Bus method
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/522846cf10edf2bee60aa6867594db1efd8cd585/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Dump/Create.interface.yaml#L16

Correct Fault Log properties to follow the interface https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/522846cf10edf2bee60aa6867594db1efd8cd585/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Dump/Entry/FaultLog.interface.yaml#L8
Probably a future enhancement, can we populate AdditionalTypeName with the terminusName from which we received the CPER event? It might be useful to isolate where we got the crashdump from.
Should this come from libpldm instead?
can you add a little more detail , on how the event is supported and its interaction with dump manager, and how this will be extracted out via external interfaces like redfish/ipmi.
Do you mean change the variable name?

i think we need to change the ergonomics of this API, it seems like its could return empty string. rather we could have it return `std::optional<std::string_view>`, if there is a value we can get the value as string_view but its there is no value , we get nullopt.
I removed the check. So this line also removed.
why do we want to check the presence of terminusName here ? even if we dont have the terminus name we are anyways going ahead and still doing the same thing.
I removed the checking. As you said `even if we dont have the terminus name we are anyways going ahead and still doing the same thing`
if this is just a warning , why not use lg2::info() ? or lg2::warning() may be  ?

I updated the code.
Thanks for your advice.
can you explain what is the need for this if-else ? and why do we need to create multiple calls to dump ?

There is two format types of CPER event. Include the HEAD + SECTION or Only SECTION.
Depend of the format types, the `Type` parameters of Dump FaultLog at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/74490/8/platform-mc/event_manager.cpp#452 will be different.
That why the if else is need.
We only create one call to dump for each CPER event.

The use of std::ofstream::exceptions and catch(const std::exception& e) might miss more specific exceptions related to file handling (like std::ios_base::failure). It would be clearer to catch the specific exception thrown.
can we follow latest lg2 style? use "e" rather than e.what().
The code will be update to use the PLDM special effecter ID in path set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/74855/1/include/libpldm/platform.h#61 which is in reviewing.
